Abstract:
Attention: The Dynamics_QC layer of the MCD12Q2 products is not performing as intended. Users are advised to ignore QC information until the issue is resolved.

The MODIS Land Cover Dynamics (MCD12Q2) product (informally called the MODIS Global Vegetation Phenology product) provides estimates of the timing of vegetation phenology at global scales. Additionally, it also provides information related to the range and summation of the enhanced vegetation index (EVI) computed from MODIS surface reflectance data at each pixel. It identifies the vegetation growth, maturity, and senescence that mark seasonal cycles. In contrast to the version 004 incarnation of this product (MOD12Q2), MCD12Q2 uses both Terra and Aqua MODIS input data. MCD12Q2 is produced once a year with 24 months of input data (i.e., the 12 months of interest data bracketed by six month’s data on either side). The version 005 MCD12Q2 products range from 2001 through 2012.

MCD12Q2 primarily uses MODIS EVI, which is computed from the MODIS Nadir Bidirectional Reflectance Distribution Function (BRDF)-Adjusted Reflectance (NBAR) product instead of the MOD09 surface reflectance product. In contrast to the version 004 product, MCD12Q2 uses NBAR values computed from an 8-day period at 500 m spatial resolution. Huete et al. (2002) provide the formula used to derive the EVI from the NBAR data. The snow and ice flag included in the MODIS NBAR product’s QA field is useful to filter out data points associated with snow-covered surfaces from the input time-series, especially because snow presence introduces large temporal variations in EVI that are not associated with vegetation phenology. Land surface temperature data inputs are derived from the MODIS MOD11A2 8-day composite products. 

Change Points of Interest

- The V005 Land Cover Dynamics product is produced at a higher spatial resolution (500 m) than the V004 product (1000 m).
- The V005 Land Cover Dynamics product uses both Aqua and Terra inputs.
- The V005 Land Cover product uses NBAR values computed from an 8-day period compared to a 16-day period in the V004 product.

The MODIS Land Cover Dynamics product provides estimates of the timing of vegetation phenology globally. In addition, it also provides the MODIS nadir bidirectional reflectance distribution function (BRDF)-adjusted reflectance (NBAR)-based enhanced vegetation index (EVI) onset of greenness, and quality control information.

V005 Data Set Characteristics: 
Temporal Coverage: 2001-2014
Earth-Gridded Tile Area: 10° x 10° lat/lon (at the equator)
Image Dimensions: 2 x 2400 x 2400 (num_modes/rows/columns) 
File Size: ~165 MB 
Resolution: 500 meters
Projection: Sinusoidal 
Data Type: 16-bit Unsigned Integer
Data Format: HDF-EOS 
Science Data Sets (HDF SDS Layers): 8

RelatedUrls.Description: Data set landing page at the LP DAAC
Interface to search, discover, and access EOS data products, and invoke available data services.
LP DAAC Data Pool provides direct access to all currently available MODIS products and the ability to download them via HTTP.

The MODIS Reprojection Tool on the Web (MRTWeb) is available for selected MODIS land products.  MRTWeb’s capabilities include reprojecting to alternate map projections, spatial and spectral subsetting, resampling, and alternate output format options.

USGS EarthExplorer (EE) provides users the ability to query, search and order archived ASTER and MODIS products available from the LP DAAC.  Registered users of EE have access to additional features than guest users.

The USGS Global Visualization Viewer (GloVis) is an online search and order tool driven by browse images.  Users may select any geographical area of interest (for any given product) and view all available browse images for that area before deciding to order those products.
Refine your granule search with ECHO's next generation Earth Science discovery tool (Reverb) using information from this record.

The Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC) is one of several discipline-specific data centers within the NASA Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS).  The LP DAAC Web page provides information about available data products, services, documentation, order interfaces, and tools.
The MODIS Land home page is maintained through NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and documents various aspects of the land component of the MODIS mission.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: HORIZONTALTILENUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Horizontal tile number of a grid, which increases from left to right.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTGOODQUALITY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of pixels with good quality

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTNOTPRODUCEDOTHER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of pixels not produced due to some reason other than cloud

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTOTHERQUALITY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of pixels with not so good quality

AdditionalAttributes.Name: VERTICALTILENUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Vertical tile number of a grid, which increases from top to bottom.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: TileID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: MODIS Land tile identification number which represents a geographical area on the surface of the Earth bounded by latitude and longitude coordinates.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSVERSION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Version of the process software that generated the product.

EntryTitle: MODIS/Terra+Aqua Land Cover Dynamics Yearly L3 Global 500m SIN Grid V005
